nodes.text: Developed during the Clone Wars, the GLX Firelance blaster rifle was a type of compact blaster rifle manufactured by SoroSuub Corporation that marketed to "freelance law enforcement agents." The GLX was immensely popular among bounty hunters and law enforcement agencies for its select-fire modes and powerful stun setting, which made it one of SoroSuub's top-selling carbines. And although the GLX was short on lethality and was pricey, bounty hunters and law enforcement officers enjoyed its extended range, versatility, and dizzying rate of fire.

The weapon was a short-barreled carbine with a barrel-integrated flash suppressor, which made it a maneuverable breach weapon for close-quarters combat. Its solid stock with built-in recoil compensators ensured control during sustained full-auto fire. Such performance-enhancing designs enabled shooters to engage targets anywhere from close quarters out to nearly half a kilometer without feeling ill-equipped.
